Worm poop is called
"casts" or "castings."

Click on the numbers in order
to reveal information about
each worm part.

Anterior

This the front end of the
worm where the mouth is.

Prostomium

The pointy, firm front
of the worm.
It helps to push and burrow.

Setae

The small bristles used
to burrow and crawl.

Mouth

This is the first part of
the digestive system
and is in the first segment.

Segment

The earthworm body
is made up of
ring-like bits.

Dorsal Pores

An opening in most
segments of the worm
that releases fluid
to keep the worm moist
and to help with respiration.

Septum

A membrane flexible
enough to allow for the
contraction of internal muscles.
Lets worms change
from round to flat
so they can burrow in dirt.

Ventral Surface

The bottom of the earthworm.

Clitellum

This non-segmented part
is about 1/3
of the way down from the head
and is where they keep
their eggs.

Anus

The valuable casts are
eliminated through the anus.

Posterior

This is the back end
of the earthworm.
